header.description: The CloudFoundry plugin will use the CloudFoundry command line utility to interact with applications in a target CloudFoundry system.

step-type.name: Push Application
step-type.description: Push application with or without a manifest file. If a manifest file is found then properties are used as overrides.

property-ui.label: API
property-ui.description: A url of the target Cloud Foundry system, such as http://api.ng.bluemix.net.

property-ui.label: Cloud Foundry User
property-ui.description: The user name of the account that will interact with Cloud Foundry system

property-ui.label: Password
property-ui.description: The password of the account that will interact with Cloud Foundry system.

property-ui.label: Organization
property-ui.description: The name of the organization where the application will be deployed.

property-ui.label: Space
property-ui.description: The name of the space within the organization that the application will be deployed.

property-ui.label: Application Name
property-ui.description: The name of the application to use when deployed. Required if not using a manifest.

property-ui.label: Manifest file
property-ui.description: Path to the manifest file. Default is to look in the working directory.

property-ui.label: Domain
property-ui.description: Set a custom domain to be used when deploying the application.

property-ui.label: Sub-domain
property-ui.description: Define a sub-domain for your application. This is useful to ensure that the URL route for the application is unique within the domain.

property-ui.label: Number of instances
property-ui.description: The number of instances of the application that will be created.

property-ui.label: Memory limit
property-ui.description: The memory limit (e.g., 256M, 1024M, 1G).

property-ui.label: Disk limit
property-ui.description: The disk limit (e.g. 256M, 1024M, 1G).

property-ui.label: Custom buildpack
property-ui.description: Custom buildpack by name (e.g. my-buildpack) or GIT URL (e.g. https://github.com/heroku/heroku-buildpack-play.git).

property-ui.label: Application path
property-ui.description: Path of app directory or zip file.

property-ui.label: Stack
property-ui.description: Stack to use (a stack is a pre-built file system, including an operating system, that can run apps).

property-ui.label: Timeout
property-ui.description: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for application start, other server side timeouts may apply.

property-ui.label: No start
property-ui.description: Does not start the application if selected.

property-ui.label: No route
property-ui.description: Does not create a URL route for the application if selected. Manually create and map a route later.

property-ui.label: No manifest
property-ui.description: Ignore the manifest file if one exists.

property-ui.label: No hostname
property-ui.description: Map the root domain to this application.

property-ui.label: Random route
property-ui.description: Create a random route for this app.
